input_text:
Job Title: Manufacturing Engineer

Location: West Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing

Description:
The Manufacturing Engineer will develop and improve production processes by observing and improving manufacturing methods. This will be a hands-on role where the employee will learn multiple different metal manufacturing processes on the job.Client DetailsThe client is a multinational manufacturing company serving some of the most prominent names in the automotive industry. Top clients include Toyota, Honda, and Subaru. Based in Japan, our client has an excellent culture and always puts their employees development and well-being at the forefront of their operation.DescriptionRead and understand product drawings/schematics from our engineers. Lead problem solving efforts to resolve production problems. Communicate with our quality and engineering teams to drive process improvements. Develop proper manufacturing, testing, and quality control standard work. Conduct in process checks on the production line to ensure standard work is followed and work-in-process, finished products, and packing meet quality requirements. Conduct final inspection on finished products and record test data. Develop and improve monthly reports to quantify Production improvement and identify areas requiring attention/improvement Determine the process capabilities and outgoing quality levels of all major products. Identify process improvement and optimization opportunities. Assist in the development and implementation of training programs, process planning, and policies. ProfileBachelor's degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering2+ years in production or process engineering/experience in a manufacturing environmentKnowledge and understanding of Lean Manufacturing principles, techniques, and philosophies Experience working in a dynamic environment, developing flexible solutions to meet evolving business needs. Experience with LCD, VFD, OLED or TFT display technologies is a plus. Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skillsJob OfferBase salary $75,000-95,000 based on experience level401(k) match Benefits through BCBS, only paying around $30/month 3 weeks PTO11 paid company holidaysInvestment in employee education, trainings, CEUs (tuition reimbursement)
MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Manufacturing Engineer
output_json.summary: The Manufacturing Engineer will develop and improve production processes by observing and improving manufacturing methods.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering
tools_and_technologies: LCD, VFD, OLED or TFT display technologies
job_responsibilities: Communicate with quality and engineering teams
Develop manufacturing, testing, and quality control standard work
benefits: Investment in employee education, trainings, CEUs (tuition reimbursement)
